Title: Auto Map Index I
DescriptionLines: All queries in RavenDB use an index.
An **Auto Index** is created when a filtering query does Not specify which index to use, and when there isn't any existing auto-index that can answer the query.

Queries that do Not specify an index are called
**dynamic queries**.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a dynamic query
DescriptionLines: * Define a query without specifying a specific index.
The above query is defined on the 'Employees' collection with no index specified.
* Note that the query includes a filtering action (using `Where()` or `Search()`).
* When an index is Not specified and a filtering action is Not applied,
an auto-index is Not created, and query results are based just on the collection data.
* => When an index is Not specified and a filtering action is applied,
RavenDB will generate an _auto-index_ for you - if needed (see next step).

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the dynamic query
DescriptionLines: * Upon query execution, the _query-optimizer_ analyzes the query to see if an _auto-index_ that can answer the query already exists,
i.e. an auto-index on the collection queried on with index-fields that match those queried on.
* If such auto-index (Not static one...) is found, it will be used to fetch the results.
Else, the query-optimizer will create a new auto-index with matching fields.
* With the above query, the following auto index will be created: _Auto/Employees/ByFirstName_,
* Note: If there exists an auto-index that is defined on the collection queried but is indexing a different field than the one queried on,
then the query-optimizer will create a new auto-index that indexes both the fields from the existing index fields and the new fields queried on.
